tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SecurityIncidents (
    incident_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date TIMESTAMP,
    incident_type VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT,
    location TEXT,
    severity INT
);

CREATE TABLE security_incidents (
    incident_id   INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date TIMESTAMP,
    incident_type VARCHAR(50),
    location      VARCHAR(100),
    description   TEXT,
    severity      INT
);

CREATE TABLE incident_analysis (
    analysis_id   INT PRIMARY KEY,
    analysis_date TIMESTAMP,
    incident_id   INT,
    analysis_result TEXT,
    analyst       VARCHAR(50),
    CONSTRAINT fk_incident FOREIGN KEY (incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_incidents (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  incident_type VARCHAR(100),
  incident_date TIMESTAMP,
  location TEXT,
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE incident_reports (
  report_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  incident_id UUID REFERENCES security_incidents(id),
  report_date TIMESTAMP,
  report_description TEXT,
  is_resolved BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE security_cameras (
  camera_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  location TEXT,
  installation_date TIMESTAMP,
  resolution VARCHAR(10),
  is_active BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE SecurityIncidents (
  incident_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  incident_date DATE,
  incident_time TIME,
  location VARCHAR,
  description TEXT,
  severity VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE IncidentReports (
  report_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  incident_id UUID REFERENCES SecurityIncidents(incident_id),
  reporter_name VARCHAR,
  report_date DATE,
  report_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE IncidentLogs (
  log_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  incident_id UUID REFERENCES SecurityIncidents(incident_id),
  log_date DATE,
  log_time TIME,
  log_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE security_incidents (
   incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   incident_type VARCHAR(100),
   incident_date DATE,
   location VARCHAR(255),
   description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE incidents_devices (
   incident_id INT,
   device_id INT,
   FOREIGN KEY (incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
   FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES devices(device_id)
)

CREATE TABLE devices (
   device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   device_type VARCHAR(100),
   installation_date DATE,
   status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
   user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   username VARCHAR(50),
   email VARCHAR(100),
   phone_number VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE incident_responses (
   response_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   incident_id INT,
   user_id INT,
   response_date TIMESTAMP,
   response_text TEXT,
   FOREIGN KEY (incident_id) REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
   FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
)
